# ::id dip_train_0001.4
# ::snt SEN send to REC that It seems like there are a lot of ways that could go wrong...I don't see why France would see you approaching/taking Munich--while I do nothing about it--and not immediately feel skittish
(a / and
      :op1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Munich")))
      :op2 (f / fear-01
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France"))
            :ARG1 h))

# ::id dip_train_0001.5
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Yeah, I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôve tried it and it works, cause I‚Äôve never tried it or seen it. But how I think it would work is (a) my Spring move looks like an attack on Austria, so it would not be surprising if you did not cover Munich. Then (b) you build two armies, which looks like we‚Äôre really at war and you‚Äôre going to eject me. Then we launch the attack in Spring. So there is really no part of this that would raise alarm bells with France.  All that said, I‚Äôve literally never done it before, and it does involve risk for you, so I‚Äôm not offended or concerned if it‚Äôs just not for you. I‚Äôm happy to play more conventionally too. Up to you.
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u / unit
                        :mod c)
                  :time (d2 / date-entity :year 1901
                        :season (s / spring)))
            :op2 (a2 / attack-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n6 / name :op1 "Austria")))
            :op3 (d / defend-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Munich")))
            :op4 (b / build-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (a5 / army :quant 2))
            :op5 (a3 / attack-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 c2)
            :op6 (a4 / attack-01
                  :ARG0 (a6 / and
                        :op1 c
                        :op2 c2)
                  :time (d3 / date-entity :year 1902
                        :season (s3 / spring)))
            :op7 (f / fear-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (c4 / country :name (n10 / name :op1 "France"))))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.9
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I don't think I'm ready to go for that idea, however I'd be down for some good ol'-fashioned Austria-kicking?
(a / and
      :op1 (r / reject-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (p2 / propose-01
                  :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
                  :ARG3 c))
      :op2 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (a2 / attack-01
                  :ARG0 (a3 / and
                        :op1 c
                        :op2 c2)
                  :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Austria")))
            :ARG3 c2))

# ::id dip_train_0001.11
# ::snt SEN send to REC that But I think I can get over ‚ÄúLagergate‚Äù and we can still be friends.   As of right now, I think Austria may be my most reliable ally. I‚Äôm thinking I‚Äôd like to play as a Central Trio if you have any interest in that. Thoughts?
(a / and
      :op1 (a2 / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Austria"))))
      :op2 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (a4 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a5 / and
                        :op1 c
                        :op2 c2
                        :op3 c3))
            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))))

# ::id dip_train_0001.13
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Well, at least I have an idea of who to trust. Obviously, my ideas are subject to change.   I understand your desire to watch behavior before committing to anything. I, personally, am a partner player. I look carefully early in the game for a small group to work with, and then I value loyalty and collaboration. I like to work closely with a tight-knit alliance.   If you prefer to hop and back and forth, or play more of an individual game, then we might not be a good match.   I‚Äôm looking for a loyal ally or two that I can coordinate with and make awesome moves with. Makes the game easier and a lot more fun.
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.14
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Just an FYI: I‚Äôve now had both England and France suggest to me that I should move to Tyrolia and France will support me to Munich in the Fall. One saying that to me is not a big deal, but with both mentioning it, my alarm bells are going off. I am concerned about an E/F.   I‚Äôm certainly not moving to Tyrolia. But I just want you to be cautious here. I feel like England and France are working together.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "England"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "France")))
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (m2 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u / unit
                              :mod c3)
                        :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Tyrolia")))
                  :op2 (s / support-01
                        :ARG0 c2
                        :ARG1 (m3 / move-01
                              :ARG1 (u2 / unit
                                    :mod c3)
                              :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Munich")))
                        :time (d / date-entity :year 1901
                              :season (f2 / fall))))
            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :op2 (f / fear-01
            :ARG0 c3
            :ARG1 (a4 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a5 / and
                        :op1 c
                        :op2 c2)))
      :op3 (m / move-01 :polarity -
            :ARG1 u
            :ARG2 p3))

# ::id dip_train_0001.15
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I appreciate the tip, but I'm wondering why you're so against ousting me from Munich if I haven't explicitly agreed to be your ally?
(a / agree-01 :polarity -
      :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a2 / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 c2
                  :op2 c))
      :ARG2 (c / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.16
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Because it is terrible, terrible play for SEN to attack REC, in my view. If I were to attack you in Munich, I could never hold Munich. So, all I would be doing is weakening you, and helping France, England, or both to get really big.   I don‚Äôt have any long-term path going north. Helping France to take you down is a sucker‚Äôs play, whether you are working with me or not.
(p / possible-01 :polarity -
      :ARG1 (h / hold-03
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Munich")))
      :condition (a / attack-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 p2))

# ::id dip_train_0001.17
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Did France tell you he was moving to Burgundy, or was that a stab?
(o / or
      :op1 (t / tell-01
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "France"))
            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u / unit
                        :mod c2)
                  :ARG2 (p / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Burgundy")))
            :ARG2 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC")))
      :op2 (b / betray-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 c))

# ::id dip_train_0001.18
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I was not informed of it, no. And England is leading me to believe it's part of a play for Belgium, so if they're working together this might be a trick...  REC, you seem like a straight shooter, and Austria has confirmed with me about your two's alliance. So I'll confide in you--this is my first ever game of diplomacy, and I think that teaming up with the two of you could help me learn more and have more fun. So, if you're still interested in a central powers alliance, I'm in.
(a / and
      :op1 (t / tell-01 :polarity -
            :ARG2 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :op2 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (l / lie-08)
            :condition (a2 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a3 / and
                        :op1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "England"))
                        :op2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))))
      :op3 (t2 / tell-01
            :ARG0 c5
            :ARG1 (a5 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a6 / and
                        :op1 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC"))
                        :op2 (c5 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "Austria"))))
            :ARG2 c)
      :op4 (p2 / propose-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (a7 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c4
                  :op3 c5)
            :ARG3 c4))

# ::id dip_train_0001.19

(a / and

                        :op1 c2

                  :ARG2 c3)))

# ::id dip_train_0001.49
# ::snt SEN send to REC that #2 Here is the move set I would suggest right now: Kiel Support Holland holding Holland Support Wales to Belgium (tell England you are going to order this support and he can take it or leave it) Munich Support Berlin holding Berlin Support Munich holding  I think that both France and Russia are about to back off you, as they are both under fire at home.                         :ARG2 (p5 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Belgium")))
                  :instrument (u2 / unit
                        :location (p3 / province)))
            :op3 (t / tell-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 s2
                  :ARG2 (c3 / country :name (n7 / name :op1 "England")))
            :op4 (s3 / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (h / hold-03
                        :ARG1 (p7 / province :name (n9 / name :op1 "Berlin")))
                  :instrument (u4 / unit
                        :location (p6 / province :name (n8 / name :op1 "Munich"))
                        :mod c2))
            :op5 (s4 / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (h3 / hold-03
                        :ARG1 p6)
                  :instrument (u5 / unit
                        :location p7
                        :mod c2)))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.50
# ::snt SEN send to REC that God, I hope so! I'm attempting to make that deal with russia now...and I'm talking with England re: Belgium
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Russia")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.51
# ::snt SEN send to REC that It‚Äôs none of my business, but if you do plan to take Denmark, I strongly recommend you wait until Fall. I think the most important thing for you right now is getting England fully committed against France. If that happens, taking Denmark later will be easy.
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (a2 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a3 / and
                        :op1 (c2 / country :name (n6 / name :op1 "REC"))
                        :op2 (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "England")))
                  :ARG3 (c4 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "France")))
            :op2 (h / have-03
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Denmark"))
                  :condition a2
                  :time (d / date-entity :year 1904
                        :season (f / fall))))
      :ARG3 c2)

# ::id dip_train_0001.52
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I think me and England are really on the same page at this point regarding France. I'm actually sort of running counter-intelligence for England (and my friends to the south, of course!) with Russia right now.   England and I talked about Denmark too...and it seems like one or the other of Denmark or Belgium should work out for me this year and I'm fine with that
(h / have-03
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (o / or
            :op1 (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Denmark"))
            :op2 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Belgium")))
      :time (d / date-entity :year 1904))

# ::id dip_train_0001.55
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I do think a move to Burgundy makes sense for you this turn, and I can‚Äôt imagine Russia attacking you here. He has a serious Austria problem.   I suggest this: Mun - Bur Ruh - Bel Hol Support Ruh - Bel  Ber - Kie  Tell Russia that the last thing in the world you want to see is Austria run him over, and you‚Äôre willing to help keep Russia viable if necessary (you‚Äôre angling for Russia to disband his northern holdings this turn).
(a / and
      :op1 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (a2 / attack-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Russia"))

                        :mod (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))
                        :location (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Burgundy")))))
      :op2 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u2 / unit
                              :location (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Munich"))
                              :mod c3)
                        :ARG2 p2)
                  :op2 (m2 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u3 / unit
                              :location (p4 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Ruhr"))
                              :mod c3)
                        :ARG2 (p5 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Belgium")))
                  :op3 (s / support-01
                        :ARG0 (u4 / unit
                              :location (p6 / province :name (n8 / name :op1 "Holland")))
                        :ARG1 m2)
                  :op4 (m3 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u5 / unit
                              :location (p7 / province :name (n9 / name :op1 "Berlin"))
                              :mod c3)
                        :ARG2 (p8 / province :name (n10 / name :op1 "Kiel"))))
            :ARG3 c3))

      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.104
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I think you should suggest to England that he gets Sweden and St Petersburg, while you get Denmark back. That‚Äôs only fair, as you have been a loyal ally in the fight against France and you plan to continue to do that.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (p2 / propose-01
                  :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
                  :ARG1 (a2 / and
                        :op1 (h / have-03
                              :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "England"))
                              :ARG1 (a3 / and
                                    :op1 (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Sweden"))
                                    :op2 (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "St." :op2 "Petersburg"))))
                        :op2 (h2 / have-03
                              :ARG0 c2
                              :ARG1 (p5 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Denmark"))))
                  :ARG3 c3)
            :ARG3 c2)
      :op2 (a4 / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a5 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2)
            :ARG3 (c4 / country :name (n7 / name :op1 "France"))))

# ::id dip_train_0001.105
# ::snt SEN send to REC that The moves I had already planned differ in one respect: I thought it would be worth the risk to try moving Hol-Bel and therefore move Bel-Bur. Even if me and France are high-fiving in Bel for a few seasons it's still mine, and it's not like Holland has anything better to do while I'm still allies with England.  ...The only reason I'm reluctant to make that agreement with England is that---while I think *you* and I have a good relationship---I really have not talked with Austria much at all, and I'm the next logical target for them when Russia's gone. And anything that's bad for Russia right now is good for Austria.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (a4 / and
                  :op1 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u / unit
                              :mod (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
                              :location (p2 / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Holland")))
                        :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Belgium")))
                  :op2 (m2 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u2 / unit
                              :mod c
                              :location p3)
                        :ARG2 (p4 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Burgundy")))))
      :op2 (a2 / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a5 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "England"))))
      :op3 (a3 / agree-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG2 c2))

# ::id dip_train_0001.106
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Hmmmm, I‚Äôm just not sure you should trust England enough right now to leave Holland open and Belgium essentially unguarded.   France is a really good player, and he is no doubt working hard to get England to turn on you. My personal take is that you are better off being a bit more conservative until you have Denmark back and England has moved another fleet towards France. But I can see it either way.
(a / and
      :op1 (t / trust-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (a2 / attack-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (a3 / and
                        :op1 (p / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Holland"))
                        :op2 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Belgium"))))
            :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "England")))
      :op2 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (a4 / and
                  :op1 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (p3 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Denmark")))
                  :op2 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u / unit
                              :mod c2)
                        :ARG2 (c4 / country :name (n7 / name :op1 "France"))))))

# ::id dip_train_0001.107
# ::snt SEN send to REC that With regard to Russia, talk it through with England. What you don‚Äôt want is England taking out Russia and giving you nothing. So, if England agrees to let Russia be for a while, then your plan sounds good. But if England is going to take Sweden, you really should get Denmark back. (I‚Äôm my view)
(p / possible-01
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (a2 / agree-01
                  :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "England"))
                  :ARG1 (a3 / attack-01 :polarity -
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Russia"))))
            :op2 (h / have-03
                  :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))
                  :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Denmark"))
                  :condition (h2 / have-03
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Sweden"))))))

# ::id dip_train_0001.108
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Okay you've convinced me: it's worth figuring out what E's plans are for Russia at least.  And you're almost certainly right, from a rational perspective, about leaving Holland/Belgium vulnerable to England. But I think England really is counting on my assistance in taking France, and because of that and other non-quantifiable reasons I trust them.
(a / and
      :op1 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "England"))
                        :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))))
      :op2 (t / trust-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG2 c2))

# ::id dip_train_0001.109
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Excellent. Obviously you have a much better feel for your relationship with England than I do. Just know that France is persuasive, and I‚Äôm sure that‚Äôs what he‚Äôs working on. He stopped talking to me, so I bet he‚Äôs trying to turn England. Just keep reassuring England that you want to work with him long-term so he doesn‚Äôt succumb to the Dark Side.
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

            :ARG3 c3)
      :ARG3 c2)

# ::id dip_train_0001.110
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Hi REC ‚Äî well, I think we‚Äôre getting to a critical point in the game here. France held out a long time, but he‚Äôs much less of a threat now. I think the critical issue, for you, is England.   I have some thoughts on the matter, and some information, but I‚Äôd like to feel confident that you and I will keep anything we say between us. I think of you as the one person who has been honest with me on every turn. You even tell me the truth when it‚Äôs bad news, or when you don‚Äôt completely trust me, and I like that.
(a / and

            :ARG0 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN"))))

                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG2 c2)
            :ARG2 c))

# ::id dip_train_0001.111
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Okay, REC. I won't share any of this conversation. And if I continue to collaborate with England, we at least have a chance of slowing that down. So I'm in sort of a conflicted spot
(a / and
      :op1 (a2 / agree-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (t / tell-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c)

# ::id dip_train_0001.112

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.113

            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "England"))

                              :op1 c

            :ARG2 c4))

# ::id dip_train_0001.138
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Yep, there's some sarcasm there. Looking back at your messages, I still don't read them as encouraging collaboration. And if you wanted us to be friends, you could have done that without betraying me to England by simply saying in your candid way "I don't think you should do that for such and such reason". But you chose to increase E's distrust of me. So I think you might be full of gnocchi and crap.   My trust in you is a bit shaken but I still think we can have a working partnership with a bit more caution on my end. It would be my preference that you hold Mao, on the assumption that if it came down to a choice between partnering with me or England, you'd choose me.       :op1 (t / trust-01 :polarity -

                              :op1 c
                              :op2 c2))))

            :ARG0 c

            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (e / expect-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c3
                  :ARG1 s)
            :ARG2 c2
            :polarity (a3 / amr-unknown)))

# ::id dip_train_0001.185
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I suggest you just not tell England anything about my moves.
(t / tell-01 :mode imperative :polarity -
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "England")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.186
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Do you want me to support England to Brest?
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (s / support-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (f / fleet
                        :mod (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "England")))
                  :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Brest"))))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0001.189
# ::snt SEN send to REC that *If* you support Eng-Brest, England has agreed to vacate denmark for me. If you don't, I won't get in the way of your channel thing. Any other questions?
(a / and
      :op1 (a2 / agree-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "England"))
            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u / unit
                        :mod c)
                  :source (p / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Denmark")))
            :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :condition (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC"))
                  :ARG1 (m2 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (f2 / fleet
                              :mod c
                              :location s2)
                        :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Brest")))))
      :op2 (p3 / prevent-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (m3 / move-01
                  :ARG1 (f / fleet
                        :mod c3)
                  :ARG2 (s2 / sea :name (n6 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel")))
            :condition (s3 / support-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 c3
                  :ARG1 m2)))

# ::id dip_train_0001.203

# ::id dip_train_0001.309
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Sent to REC, England, Austria, Russia: So, England, REC, Russia, y‚Äôall played a great turn last turn. You got me to stab my long-time ally and you ended our pretty excellent 7-year run as an alliance. Russia told me he was with me if I stab Austria. England told me he wanted me to solo so long as I would ‚Äúteach him‚Äù and help his along to second place. Then y‚Äôall pulled the rug out from under me. It was clever and effective. (End Part 1)
(a / and
      :op1 (b / betray-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))
      :op2 (a2 / ally-01 :polarity -
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2))
      :op3 (t / tell-01
            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Russia"))
            :ARG1 (a4 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 c3
                  :ARG2 c
                  :condition (b2 / betray-01
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Austria"))))
            :ARG2 c)
      :op4 (t2 / tell-01
            :ARG0 (c5 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "England"))
            :ARG1 (a5 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a6 / and
                        :op1 c5
                        :op2 c))
            :ARG2 c)
      :op5 (b3 / betray-01
            :ARG0 (a7 / and
                  :op1 c3
                  :op2 c5
                  :op3 c2)
            :ARG1 c))

# ::id dip_train_0001.310
# ::snt SEN send to REC that (Part 2) At this stage, my excitement about the game has diminished quite a bit. And of course I‚Äôm happy to play on and take my lumps for falling for ‚ÄúHey, I really want you to solo, just help me place second,‚Äù but if you guys just want to call it a five-way draw among us and grab a beer together, while reviewing the statistics, that‚Äôs really my preference.   I am outnumbered and I obviously can‚Äôt solo. And I‚Äôm sure some of you in the north are eager to send everyone else flying my way, but I expect Russia and England to be careful, and so I‚Äôm not sure there is much room to move forward without simply tipping the board to REC‚Äôs favor.   I propose that we draw and hug it out.ü§ó
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG3 (a / and
            :op1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :op2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "England"))
            :op3 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Russia"))))

# ::id dip_train_0001.311
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I'm down for a five-way draw.   ...and by the way, England was copy-pasting to me the most incriminating messages you sent them. So I knew you were giving England my moves. I do have a certain begrudging respect for you ability to deny, though üòâ
(a / and
      :op1 (a2 / agree-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 c

            :ARG2 c))

# ::id dip_train_0001.315
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I have no doubt you would have continued to work with me, but I take issue with someone who can be asked point-blank if they're sharing moves with another player and lie to my face. (a / and

# ::id dip_train_0002.2

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0002.43
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I‚Äôm thinking about sending an army over to Piedmont to keep France honest. Do you think that is a good idea or a terrible idea? I just want to avoid a stampede over Germany, and I feel like forcing him to use an army in Marseilles to bounce with me is worth dedicating one army from me. But I don‚Äôt want to antagonize I‚Äôve him either. I keep going back and forth about it. What do you think?
(p / possible-01
      :ARG1 (m / move-01
            :ARG1 (a / army
                  :mod (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN")))
            :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Piedmont"))

                  :ARG1 (a2 / army
                        :mod (c2 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))
                  :ARG2 a
                  :ARG3 (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Marseille")))))

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
      :ARG1 (b / build-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (a / amr-unknown)))

            :ARG2 c2)
      :op3 (h3 / have-03
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Liverpool")))
      :op4 (h4 / have-03 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (p4 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Portugal")))
      :op5 (s / support-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (t / transport-01
                  :ARG0 (f2 / fleet
                        :mod c)
                  :ARG1 (a4 / army)
                  :ARG3 p3
                  :ARG4 (s2 / sea :name (n8 / name :op1 "Mid-Atlantic" :op2 "Ocean")))
            :instrument (f / fleet
                  :mod c
                  :location (p5 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Spain"))))
      :op6 (b / build-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (u / unit)
            :condition (h5 / have-03
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 p2)))

# ::id dip_train_0002.136

                  :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Russia"))
                  :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Romania"))))

                        :ARG0 c3
                        :ARG1 p2

                              :location (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Bulgaria"))))

            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC"))))

# ::id dip_train_0003.2
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen Wintergreen. (p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2)

                  :op2 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Austria"))))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0004.10
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Then you secure Tun with your fleet in the fall. For the unit in Pie, you can decide to bait France into a bounce in Mar, but then just hold instead. France would move from Spain to Mar and miss securing the fifth supply center. This is certainly aggressive, but it also keeps you and France on a more level playing field.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (f / fleet
                        :mod c2)
                  :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Tunisia"))
                  :time (d / date-entity :year 1901
                        :season (f2 / fall)))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))
      :op2 (m2 / move-01
            :ARG1 (u / unit
                  :location (p4 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Spain"))
                  :mod (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "France")))
            :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Marseille"))
            :condition (h / hold-03
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (p5 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Piedmont")))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.11
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Well, I‚Äôd be inclined to do that if I knew you were moving to the Channel and Wales. If you want for both of us to go all in at the same time, then let‚Äôs go.
(p / possible-01
      :ARG1 (a / agree-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :condition (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (f / fleet
                        :mod c2)
                  :ARG2 (a2 / and
                        :op1 (s / sea :name (n3 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel"))
                        :op2 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Wales"))))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.12
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Yeah, that makes sense. Unfortunately we've declared a DMZ in the channel through 1902, so I can't commit to the stab right now. I still don't think it's an awful play for you. If France gets a fleet in Mar and has one parked in Spain s.c. at the start of 1902, that's going to be a little threatening for you.
(a / and
      :op1 (d / demilitarize-01
            :ARG1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG2 (s / sea :name (n2 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel"))
            :time (d2 / date-interval :op1 1901 :op2 1902))
      :op2 (p / possible-01

                  :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "France"))
                  :ARG1 (a2 / and
                        :op1 (f / fleet
                              :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Marseille"))
                              :mod c2)

                              :location (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Spain"))
                              :mod c2))
                  :time (d3 / date-entity :year 1902))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.13
# ::snt SEN send to REC that (1) If you‚Äôve declared a DMZ, then you ARE in position to do this if you want to do it. (2) I‚Äôm not going to attack France on my own.
(a / attack-01 :polarity -
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "France"))
      :condition (a2 / attack-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 c2))

# ::id dip_train_0004.14
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Yeah, everything you're saying makes sense. When I make specific agreements like the DMZ, I generally try to hold them, especially early game. Honestly, I'd rather the three of us pick apart germany to start. Maybe we could convince France to help you into Munich in the Fall?
(a / and
      :op1 (a2 / agree-01
            :ARG0 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "France")))
            :ARG1 (d / demilitarize-01

                        :op1 c
                        :op2 c2)
                  :ARG2 (s / sea :name (n3 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel"))))
      :op2 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (p2 / propose-01
                  :ARG0 c3
                  :ARG1 (s2 / support-01
                        :ARG0 c2

                              :ARG1 (u / unit
                                    :mod c3)
                              :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Munich")))

                              :season (f / fall)))
                  :ARG3 c2)
            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC"))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.16
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Great time to check in. France and Germany are in conflict, and don't seem poised to collaborate on invading me, which I'm happy about. (a / and
      :op1 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

                              :mod (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC")))

                              :mod c4)

                        :ARG1 (u3 / unit
                              :mod (o2 / or
                                    :op1 c4
                                    :op2 (c6 / country :name (n6 / name :op1 "Austria"))))
                        :ARG2 (p / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Munich")))))
      :op2 (h / have-03 :polarity -
            :ARG0 (c7 / country :name (n8 / name :op1 "Russia"))
            :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n9 / name :op1 "Sevastopol"))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.29
# ::snt SEN send to REC that France has FOUR armies, and now he has a wide open runway to roll right over Germany. If you help him, you‚Äôre going to regret it. Look two game years ahead, France is going to be in a crazy good position.   On the other hand, if you change course now and go get France instead, France is NEVER going to be able to build a second fleet. He will be so much easier to destroy. And Germany is so green...he‚Äôll be much easier to take down second.   I just...I can see where this is headed. I know it‚Äôs attractive just to take that easy build. But that is the apple of knowledge and France is the devilish serpent (end part 2)
(p / possible-01 :polarity -
      :ARG1 (b / build-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "France"))
            :ARG1 (f / fleet))
      :condition (a / attack-01
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 c))

# ::id dip_train_0004.30
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I really REALLY believe that it‚Äôs better for you and me for you to switch course and take out France now. I‚Äôd be happy to help and give you most of the spoils. (p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2)
            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0004.32

            :ARG1 (a / and
                  :op1 (u / unit
                        :mod (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
                        :mod (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Austria")))
                  :op2 (u2 / unit))
            :ARG2 (p / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Munich"))))

                  :op2 (c5 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "France"))))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0004.35

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Munich")))

# ::id dip_train_0004.38

      :op2 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (h / hold-03
                  :ARG1 p4

                        :op1 (m / move-01 :polarity -
                              :ARG1 (u5 / unit
                                    :location p6
                                    :mod (c3 / country :name (n7 / name :op1 "France"))))
                        :op2 (m2 / move-01 :polarity -

                              :ARG2 p7)))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.60
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I‚Äôm ready, but i may want your advice on some of the tactics. My plan is to completely cold shoulder France in negotiations and start an attack. We‚Äôll want to get germany on board, but I think Germany is playing a bit neutral for survival purposes right now.

      :op1 (a2 / attack-01
            :ARG0 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))
            :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))
      :op2 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (a4 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2)
            :ARG1 (a5 / attack-01
                  :ARG0 c4
                  :ARG1 c3)
            :ARG3 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Germany"))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.61
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I agree with regard to Germany‚Äôs strategy, but I believe he hates France most and he will be with you if both you and I move on France now.   France is getting no builds. Let‚Äôs just put the clamps on now! I will move to TYS and Tun if you will move either to take Belgium, or to position your fleets at Irish/Channel.   If we both take the plunge, there is nothing he can do.
(a / and
      :op1 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (a2 / attack-01
                  :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Germany"))
                  :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France"))
                  :condition (a3 / attack-01
                        :ARG0 (a4 / and
                              :op1 c
                              :op2 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC")))
                        :ARG1 c3
                        :time (d / date-entity :year 1903
                              :season (f / fall)))))
      :op2 (b / build-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c3
            :ARG1 (u / unit))
      :op3 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (a5 / and
                  :op1 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (f3 / fleet
                              :mod c)
                        :ARG2 (a6 / and
                              :op1 (s / sea :name (n5 / name :op1 "Tyrrhenian" :op2 "Sea"))
                              :op2 (p2 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Tunisia"))))
                  :op2 (m2 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (f2 / fleet
                              :mod c4)
                        :ARG2 (o / or
                              :op1 (p3 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Belgium"))
                              :op2 (s2 / sea :name (n8 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel"))
                              :op3 (s3 / sea :name (n9 / name :op1 "Irish" :op2 "Sea")))))
            :ARG3 c4))

# ::id dip_train_0004.62

# ::id dip_train_0004.121
# ::snt SEN send to REC that From France: "I can stop REC this turn by the way. It's pretty easy since REC let me into Marseilles, I can support the hold in Marseilles and Marseilles can support MAO to Spain SC. It's impossible to breach, I've checked it, and I can keep making those orders for years and years. You stabbed me in Spring 03. It is Fall 05. I think that you, REC, and Germany are highly underestimating my ability to survive against your onslaught. You sure this is the game you want? Slowly whittling away at me until I die? Instead, I propose that we let you into the Mid Atlantic Ocean and that you help me defend REC. I can send you past the MAO into West Med, where you can start taking dots like Tunis or Naples. We wait until AI crumbles, and you have an excellent game where you top the board."
(t / tell-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "France"))
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (p / possible-01
                  :ARG1 (a2 / and
                        :op1 (s / support-01
                              :ARG0 c
                              :ARG1 (h / hold-03
                                    :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Marseille"))))
                        :op2 (s2 / support-01
                              :ARG1 (m / move-01
                                    :ARG1 (f2 / fleet
                                          :location (s3 / sea :name (n4 / name :op1 "Mid-Atlantic" :op2 "Ocean")))
                                    :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Spain")))
                              :instrument (u / unit
                                    :location p2))))
            :op2 (b / betray-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 c
                  :time (d / date-entity :year 1903
                        :season (s4 / spring)))
            :op3 (p4 / propose-01
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 (a3 / and
                        :op1 (m2 / move-01
                              :ARG1 (f3 / fleet
                                    :mod c2)
                              :ARG2 s3)
                        :op2 (d2 / defend-01
                              :ARG0 (a4 / and
                                    :op1 c
                                    :op2 c2)
                              :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n6 / name :op1 "REC")))
                        :op3 (t2 / transport-01
                              :ARG0 (f / fleet
                                    :mod c)
                              :ARG1 (f4 / fleet
                                    :mod c2)
                              :ARG3 (s5 / sea :name (n7 / name :op1 "Western" :op2 "Mediterranean")))
                        :op4 (h2 / have-03
                              :ARG0 c2

                                    :op2 (p6 / province :name (n9 / name :op1 "Naples")))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.183

            :ARG0 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :op2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC")))

                              :ARG0 c2)))))

      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0004.229
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I think you need to justify to me why supporting into Brest isn't an option. I don't see how this could be relevant to some larger plan. Unless the plan is "don't give SEN that build, don't show others that I'm supporting SEN"
(p / possible-01 :polarity -
      :ARG1 (s / support-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (f / fleet
                        :mod (c2 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "SEN"))

      :purpose (a / amr-unknown))

            :ARG2 c2))

# ::id dip_train_0004.282
# ::snt SEN send to REC that She wanted me to support her direct from Paris to Brest, but I convinced her that you would likely fear a forced disband, so you were likely to try to keep me out of Gascony (thus Par S Spa - Gas).

            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Germany"))
            :ARG1 (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u / unit
                              :mod c
                              :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Paris")))
                        :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Brest"))))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :op2 (t / tell-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (e / expect-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (p4 / prevent-01
                        :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "REC"))
                        :ARG1 (m2 / move-01
                              :ARG1 (u4 / unit
                                    :mod c2)
                              :ARG2 c)))
            :ARG2 c)
      :op3 (p5 / propose-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (s2 / support-01
                  :ARG1 (m3 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u3 / unit
                              :location (p6 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Spain")))
                        :ARG2 (p7 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Gascony")))
                  :instrument (u2 / unit
                        :location p2))
            :ARG3 c3))

      :op1 (p / possible-01 :polarity -
            :ARG1 (h / hold-03
                  :ARG0 (a2 / and

# ::id dip_train_0004.340
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Haha yeah I suppose. But this game for me is about learning.       :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2))

            :ARG3 c2))

(e / expect-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Germany"))
            :ARG1 (p / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Brest"))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.404
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I think you tell her ‚Äúyes,‚Äù but then order Pic to Bre and Channel to London. That way France moves out of Brest, and you bounce Germany in Brest and keep it.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (t / tell-01
                        :ARG0 c2
                        :ARG1 (a3 / agree-01
                              :ARG0 c2
                              :ARG2 c3)
                        :ARG2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Germany")))
                  :op2 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u / unit
                              :location (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Picardy"))
                              :mod c2)
                        :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Brest")))
                  :op3 (m2 / move-01
                        :ARG1 (f / fleet
                              :location (s / sea :name (n6 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel"))
                              :mod c2)
                        :ARG2 (p4 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "London"))))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))
      :op2 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (m3 / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u3 / unit
                        :location p3
                        :mod (c4 / country :name (n8 / name :op1 "France")))))
      :op3 (p5 / possible-01
            :ARG1 (a4 / and
                  :op1 (b / bounce-03
                        :ARG1 (m4 / move-01
                              :ARG1 (u4 / unit
                                    :mod c3)
                              :ARG2 (u5 / unit
                                    :mod c2)
                              :ARG3 p3))
                  :op2 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 c2
                        :ARG1 p3))))

# ::id dip_train_0004.461
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Sent to Germany, REC, Austria, Russia: So, REC, Germany, Russia, y‚Äôall played a great turn last turn. You got me to stab my long-time ally and you ended our pretty excellent 7-year run as an alliance. Russia told me he was with me if I stab Austria. REC told me he wanted me to solo so long as I would ‚Äúteach him‚Äù and help his along to second place. Then y‚Äôall pulled the rug out from under me. It was clever and effective. (End Part 1)
(a / and
      :op1 (b / betray-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))
      :op2 (a2 / ally-01 :polarity -

                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2))
      :op3 (t / tell-01
            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Russia"))
            :ARG1 (a4 / ally-01
                  :ARG1 (a5 / and
                        :op1 c3
                        :op2 c)
                  :condition (b2 / betray-01
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Austria"))))
            :ARG2 c)
      :op4 (b3 / betray-01
            :ARG0 (a6 / and
                  :op1 (c5 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "Germany"))
                  :op2 c2
                  :op4 c3)
            :ARG1 c))

# ::id dip_train_0007.17
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I'm sure you're already on top of this, but if we can all recognize Italy as the enemy, then your best bet right now is to try and team up with Russia. # ::snt SEN send to REC that Well, I'll let you mull that over, and add another suggestion:  Would you be willing to support one of Gal or Rum into Bud from Vie? But we needed England to have a build in case Italy made landfall on the British Isle.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (o / or
                              :op1 (u2 / unit
                                    :location (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Galicia")))
                              :op2 (u3 / unit
                                    :location (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Romania"))))
                        :ARG2 (p5 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Budapest")))
                  :instrument (u / unit
                        :mod c2
                        :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Vienna"))))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))
      :op2 (h / have-03 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (p6 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Sweden"))
            :purpose (b / build-01
                  :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n8 / name :op1 "England"))
                  :ARG1 (u4 / unit)
                  :purpose (d / defend-01
                        :ARG0 c3
                        :ARG1 c3
                        :ARG3 (c4 / country :name (n9 / name :op1 "Italy"))))))

# ::id dip_train_0008.40
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Yeah, I already preemptively cursed at him but noted I understood he needed the build.    And, yes, I'll happily support him to Budapest if he ever fecking starts talking to me again. He hasn't responded to me in more than two years

      :ARG1 (s / support-01

                  :ARG0 c3
                  :ARG2 c))

# ::snt SEN send to REC that So my reasoning is that I think France is a stronger player than either of us, or at least a more engaged one. I'm getting all this tactical analysis and commentary about the state of the whole board and all that. If I help France, France probably beats me. If we defeat France together, I think we each end up with an even fighting chance.
(p / propose-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 c
                  :op2 c2)
            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0009.42
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Haha yeah that was kind of my thinking. Russia is a little tied up in the south, and so I don't expect aggression in the north. However, france would respond to a stab by begging for Russian (and potentially austrian and italian) assistance. So the choice next year is between containing russia or being aggressive (which would mean going for sweden or St. P). I think the builds we see this winter will make it more clear what's possible.
(a / and
      :op1 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (a3 / attack-01 :polarity -
                        :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Russia")))))
      :op2 (a4 / ally-01
            :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France"))
            :ARG2 (o / or
                  :op1 c2
                  :op2 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Austria"))
                  :op3 (c5 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "Italy")))
            :condition (b / betray-01
                  :ARG1 c3))
      :op3 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (o2 / or
                  :op1 (p2 / prevent-01
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (a5 / attack-01
                              :ARG0 c2))
                  :op2 (a6 / attack-01
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (o3 / or
                              :op1 (p3 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Sweden"))
                              :op2 (p4 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "St." :op2 "Petersburg")))))
            :time (d / date-entity :year 1902)))

# ::id dip_train_0009.43
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Speaking of, what are your planned builds? I'm building a fleet in London.
(b / build-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (f / fleet)
      :location (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "London")))

# ::id dip_train_0009.44
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Armies in Kiel and Munich
(b / build-01
      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (a2 / army
                  :mod c
                  :location (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Kiel")))
            :op2 (a3 / army
                  :mod c
                  :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Munich")))))

# ::id dip_train_0009.45
# ::snt SEN send to REC that What are your plans for your north sea and London fleets?  I'm trying to decide now how best to handle Belgium and that is going to depend on whether France is concerned with defending Brest or if instead they expect help from you in disrupting anything I try to do from Holland.   ...I can offer you support in moving into Sweden in exchange for supporting my Burgundy troops into Belgium? Is that worth more than whatever France might be offering you right now?
(a / and
      :op1 (p / possible-01
            :ARG1 (o / or
                  :op1 (d / defend-01

                                    :location (p4 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Holland")))))))
      :op2 (p5 / propose-01

                                    :mod c3)

                        :ARG0 c3

                                    :mod c2
                                    :location (p7 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Burgundy")))
                              :ARG2 (p8 / province :name (n8 / name :op1 "Belgium")))))
            :ARG3 (c3 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "REC"))))

# ::id dip_train_0009.50
# ::snt SEN send to REC that My once concern about the full-on france stab would be that the job couldn't be done quickly enough.       :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (p / possible-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (b / betray-01
                        :ARG0 (a2 / and
                              :op1 c

                        :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "France"))
                        :time (d / date-entity :year 1902)))
            :op2 (p2 / possible-01
                  :ARG1 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 (a3 / and
                              :op1 c
                              :op2 c3)
                        :ARG1 (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Belgium"))
                        :time (d2 / date-entity :year 1902)))

                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Spain")))

                        :ARG0 c2
                        :ARG1 (u / unit)
                        :location (p6 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Brest"))
                        :condition (d3 / dislodge-01
                              :ARG1 (a4 / army)
                              :ARG2 p3)))))

                        :ARG0 c

# ::id dip_train_0009.73

                              :op1 (s2 / sea :name (n5 / name :op1 "North" :op2 "Atlantic" :op3 "Ocean"))

                        :time (d / date-entity :year 1906)))
            :condition (h / have-03
                  :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Denmark"))))
      :op2 (e / expect-01

            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (m / move-01 :polarity -
                        :ARG1 (u / unit)

                  :op2 (l / lose-02
                        :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n9 / name :op1 "France"))
                        :ARG1 p3))))

Wrt the next couple years, my idea is this: it's crucial that you take Mao, and that I take Paris. # ::id dip_train_0009.392
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I think Italy wanted to be the one to tell me so he would keep my trust. I‚Äôd have to look to see whether this was revealed before or after Brest went through, but I know at least that before Brest I was confident he wasn‚Äôt going for the channel.

      :op1 (e / expect-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG2 c2))

# ::id dip_train_0009.553
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Hi REC, I know that the last thing I said to you was that a partnership between us wouldn't work out, but I've had a genuine change of heart. The reason for that is that I think Italy is far more duplicitous than any of us ever realized; right now they may be promising you that you'll take centers of mine, and maybe even that you two will share a victory together. This is my guess because these are the promises they made to me not so long ago. But we both need to face facts: Italy has never hesitated to profit from discord between us, and will always aid the weaker of us at the expense of the stronger.  If you're tired of being manipulated in a game Italy feels they own, I have a proposal that might get us both destroyed, but at least we'll have stuck up for ourselves and perhaps minorly inconvenienced Italy on their path to victory. This proposal involves France, who is more than willing to use their last few turns to fight back against Italy. Trusting them may be a hard sell, but so is trusting me. If I were really trying to trick you, I wouldn't ask something so unreasonable as that you trust us both. But frankly I consider knocking Italy down a peg to be the sole most urgent thing we can do to keep this game viable for any of us.  My proposal is: NWG-Cly, Nth convoy Hol-Yor, Eng-IRI or Wal, Bel s Bre-Eng, Pic-Bre, Par-Pic, Bur-Par, Mun-Bur (I figure I'm about to lose Mun anyway, and if that happens I'll disband my Hel fleet) Next year we'll be well-positioned to boot Italy off the island and the iberian. What do you think?
(a / and
      :op1 (l / lie-08
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Italy"))
            :ARG2 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :op2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))))

                              :op1 c2
                              :op2 c4))

                        :ARG1 (f2 / fleet

                        :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Clyde")))

                        :ARG1 (u3 / unit
                              :mod (p3 / province :name (n8 / name :op1 "Holland")))

                              :location (s2 / sea :name (n7 / name :op1 "North" :op2 "Sea"))))

                              :location (s3 / sea :name (n10 / name :op1 "English" :op2 "Channel")))

                              :ARG2 s3)

                              :location (p6 / province :name (n13 / name :op1 "Belgium"))))

                        :ARG1 (u10 / unit

            :ARG0 c2

                              :op2 c3
                              :op3 c4)
                        :ARG1 c
                        :time (d / date-entity :year 1908)))))

# ::id dip_train_0009.554
# ::snt SEN send to REC that (this part is not for copy-pasting to Italy) I designed this plan to make it look safe for Italy to convoy Gas-Lvp. I know this is what they'd really like to do. I think we need to do everything we can to try and disrupt this. I know it's a riskier move trying to assist Bre into Mao but I think it's the right one. I also think that for *extra* insurance NWG should poke NAO, because worst-case scenario Italy doesn't try the convoy and moves Nao-Lvp and also moves Mao-Nao to bounce. This guarantees Bre makes it into Mao which strengthens our ability to take the southern holdings, and at worst only sets you back a turn in terms of kicking Italy out of Liverpool. In exchange for doing this riskier move, I agree to convoy to york instead of Edi and give up my build. That part of the fake plan is actually true
(a / and
      :op1 (t / tell-01 :polarity - :mode imperative

                              :location (s / sea :name (n6 / name :op1 "Norwegian" :op2 "Sea"))))

                              :mod c)

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (a / and
            :op1 (a2 / agree-01
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC")))
            :op2 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u / unit
                        :mod c)
                  :ARG2 (p / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "London")))
            :op3 (m2 / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u2 / unit
                        :mod c)
                  :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Edinburgh")))
            :op4 (e / expect-01
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 (b / bounce-03
                        :ARG1 (u3 / unit
                              :mod c)
                        :ARG3 (o / or
                              :op1 p
                              :op2 p2))))
      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Italy")))

                  :location p2)

# ::snt SEN send to REC that I know you trust Italy a ton and it's clear you have a great relationship. So this must be really hard to hear. But you have to stab Italy this turn or he soloes. Germany and England are fighting and I'm Italy's janissary. No stalemate lines in sight. You won't get another chance after this.
(a / and
      :op1 (t / trust-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Italy")))
      :op2 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (b / betray-01
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 c2)
            :ARG3 c))

# ::id dip_train_0015.33

      :ARG1 (a2 / and
            :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "England"))
            :op3 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Germany")))
      :ARG3 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Italy")))

            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "England"))
            :ARG1 (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Paris")))
                  :instrument (u / unit
                        :mod c2
                        :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Burgundy"))))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :op2 (r / reject-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 p)
      :op3 (t / tell-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (s2 / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n5 / name :op1 "REC")))
            :ARG2 c))

      :ARG0 (f / fleet
            :mod (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :ARG1 (a / army
            :location (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "North" :op2 "Africa")))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "France")))

# ::id dip_train_0023.463

      :ARG1 (s / support-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "France"))

                  :ARG1 (a / army
                        :mod (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
                        :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Venice")))
                  :ARG2 (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Munich")))))

# ::id dip_train_0023.478

      :ARG1 (m / move-01
            :ARG1 (u / unit
                  :location (p2 / province :name (n / name :op1 "Venice"))

                  :ARG2 u)))

            :ARG2 (s3 / sea :name (n6 / name :op1 "Aegean" :op2 "Sea"))))

# ::snt SEN send to REC that Russia is asking me to support him into Sweden. I‚Äôd prefer if you just continue to bounce him out. So I can grab St. Pete. Then you can have Sweden.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Russia"))
            :ARG1 (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))
                  :ARG1 (m / move-01
                        :ARG1 (u / unit
                              :mod c)
                        :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Sweden"))))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :op2 (p3 / propose-01
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (b / bounce-03
                        :ARG1 (u2 / unit
                              :mod c)
                        :ARG2 (u3 / unit
                              :mod c3)
                        :ARG3 p2)
                  :op2 (h / have-03
                        :ARG0 c2
                        :ARG1 (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "St." :op2 "Petersburg")))
                  :op3 (h2 / have-03
                        :ARG0 c3
                        :ARG1 p2))
            :ARG3 c3))

# ::id dip_train_0030.29
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Would you be willing to support me into Paris?

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

                  :ARG1 (u / unit
                        :mod c)
                  :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Paris"))))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0030.35
# ::snt SEN send to REC that ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs asking for my support too. I‚Äôm not committal. I‚Äôm open to it because  he didn‚Äôt screw me in Ber last year.‚Äù
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Russia"))
            :ARG1 (s / support-01
                  :ARG0 c2)
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN")))
      :op2 (a2 / attack-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (u / unit
                  :mod c2
                  :location (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Berlin")))
            :time (d / date-entity :year 1901))
      :op3 (p3 / possible-01
            :ARG1 (a3 / agree-01
                  :ARG0 c2
                  :ARG1 s
                  :ARG2 c)))

# ::id dip_train_0030.39
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Can I count on your support into Paris?

      :polarity (a2 / amr-unknown))

            :ARG1 (c3 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "Italy"))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.41

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (l / lose-02
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (s / supply-center)))

# ::id dip_train_0030.43

      :condition (h / hold-03
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Norway"))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.44

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))

            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Sweden")))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0030.50
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Well you already have Belgium and Holland. Paris is all yours.  Italy can have marseille and Spain and I can take Brest and Portugal. What do you think of that? Then we all head east to face Austria and turkey.
(a / and
      :op1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (a2 / and
                  :op1 (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Belgium"))
                  :op2 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Holland"))))
      :op2 (p3 / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (a3 / and
                  :op1 (h2 / have-03
                        :ARG0 c
                        :ARG1 (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Paris")))
                  :op2 (h3 / have-03
                        :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n6 / name :op1 "Italy"))
                        :ARG1 (a4 / and
                              :op1 (p5 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Marseille"))
                              :op2 (p6 / province :name (n8 / name :op1 "Spain"))))
                  :op3 (h4 / have-03
                        :ARG0 c2
                        :ARG1 (a5 / and
                              :op1 (p7 / province :name (n9 / name :op1 "Brest"))
                              :op2 (p8 / province :name (n10 / name :op1 "Portugal")))))
            :ARG3 c)
      :op3 (a6 / ally-01
            :ARG1 (a7 / and
                  :op1 c2
                  :op2 c
                  :op3 c3)
            :ARG3 (a8 / and
                  :op1 (c4 / country :name (n11 / name :op1 "Austria"))
                  :op2 (c5 / country :name (n12 / name :op1 "Turkey")))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.51
# ::snt SEN send to REC that That is if Austria doesn‚Äôt stab Italy first

            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Austria"))
            :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Italy"))))

            :ARG1 (a2 / ally-01

                        :op2 (c4 / country :name (n4 / name :op1 "REC"))))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.57
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I have one additional term. I need control of the North Sea. If I have the North Sea, I can move my units  in Denmark Holland and Belgium away to focus on supporting other offences. I can‚Äôt risk being knifed in the back and cannot keep three units defending against the North Sea to feel safe.
(a / and
      :op1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (h / have-03
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 (s / sea :name (n3 / name :op1 "North" :op2 "Sea")))
            :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (a2 / and
                        :op1 (u / unit
                              :location (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Denmark"))
                              :mod c)
                        :op2 (u2 / unit
                              :location (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Holland"))
                              :mod c)
                        :op3 (u3 / unit
                              :location (p5 / province :name (n6 / name :op1 "Belgium"))
                              :mod c)))
            :condition h))

# ::id dip_train_0030.60

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (h / have-03
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (s / sea :name (n3 / name :op1 "North" :op2 "Sea"))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.61

                        :mod c2)

      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

                  :ARG3 c3)
            :ARG2 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Austria")))
      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

# ::id dip_train_0030.205
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Another thought - maybe, we agree that if we want to break the alliance after Austria is subdued we have a one term armistice so we can regroup and prepare, once again to reduce risk of stab

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (p2 / peace
            :op1 c
            :op2 c2
            :duration (t / temporal-quantity :quant 1
                  :unit (y / year))
            :purpose (b / betray-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (a / and
                        :op1 c

                  :ARG1 (a2 / and
                        :op1 c

      :ARG3 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC")))

                  :mod c

                  :mod c

                  :mod c)))

                  :ARG0 c3

                        :ARG0 c3
                        :ARG1 s
                        :ARG2 c)
                  :ARG2 c)
            :ARG3 c2))

      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Austria"))
      :condition (b / betray-01 :polarity -
            :ARG0 c2
            :ARG1 c))

# ::snt SEN send to REC that Can you get on board with that? Full disclosure I feel kinda shakey since you suggested supporting Austria into Warsaw.

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
      :ARG1 (s / support-01
            :ARG0 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (m / move-01
                  :ARG1 (u / unit
                        :mod (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "Austria")))
                  :ARG2 (p / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Warsaw")))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.335
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Here are my orders:       A Ber - Sil A Bur H F Den - HEL A Mun - Boh F NTH H A Par S Pic - Bre A Ruh - Mun A Sil - Gal A War S Sil - Gal
(a / and
      :op1 (m / move-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / army
                  :mod (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
                  :location (p / province :name (n2 / name :op1 "Berlin")))
            :ARG2 (p2 / province :name (n3 / name :op1 "Silesia")))
      :op2 (h / hold-17
            :ARG1 (a3 / army
                  :location (p3 / province :name (n4 / name :op1 "Burgundy"))
                  :mod c))
      :op3 (m2 / move-01
            :ARG1 (f / fleet
                  :mod c
                  :location (p4 / province :name (n5 / name :op1 "Denmark")))
            :ARG2 (s / sea :name (n6 / name :op1 "Heligoland" :op2 "Bight")))
      :op4 (m3 / move-01
            :ARG1 (a4 / army
                  :mod c
                  :location (p5 / province :name (n7 / name :op1 "Munich")))
            :ARG2 (p6 / province :name (n8 / name :op1 "Bohemia")))
      :op5 (h2 / hold-17
            :ARG1 (f2 / fleet
                  :location (s2 / sea :name (n9 / name :op1 "North" :op2 "Sea"))
                  :mod c))
      :op6 (s3 / support-01
            :ARG0 c
            :ARG1 (m4 / move-01
                  :ARG1 (a6 / army
                        :location (p8 / province :name (n11 / name :op1 "Picardy")))
                  :ARG2 (p9 / province :name (n12 / name :op1 "Brest")))
            :instrument (a5 / army
                  :location (p7 / province :name (n10 / name :op1 "Paris"))))
      :op7 (m5 / move-01
            :ARG1 (a7 / army
                  :mod c
                  :location (p10 / province :name (n13 / name :op1 "Ruhr")))
            :ARG2 p5)
      :op8 (s4 / support-01
            :ARG0 c

                  :ARG1 (a9 / army
                        :mod c
                        :location p2)
                  :ARG2 (p12 / province :name (n15 / name :op1 "Galicia")))
            :instrument (a8 / army
                  :location (p11 / province :name (n14 / name :op1 "Warsaw")))))

# ::id dip_train_0030.337
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Don‚Äôt let Austria smooth talk you. He‚Äôs really good. He wants me to hit you lol, as always.

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "REC"))
      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Austria")))

# ::id dip_train_0030.338

      :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Austria"))
      :ARG1 (p / propose-01
            :ARG0 (c3 / country :name (n3 / name :op1 "REC"))
            :ARG1 (a / attack-01
                  :ARG0 c
                  :ARG1 c2)
            :ARG3 c)
      :ARG2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "SEN")))

            :ARG1 (a3 / ally-01 :polarity -
                  :ARG1 (a4 / and
                        :op1 c2
                        :op2 c))))

                  :ARG1 (a4 / and
                        :op1 c
                        :op2 c2))))

# ::id dip_train_0032.27
# ::snt SEN send to REC that I'm still on attacking him
(p / possible-01
      :ARG1 (a / attack-01
            :ARG0 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "SEN"))
            :ARG1 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "England"))))

# ::id dip_train_0039.3
# ::snt SEN send to REC that Austria and Italy are allying FYI
(a / ally-01
      :ARG1 (a2 / and
            :op1 (c / country :name (n / name :op1 "Austria"))
            :op2 (c2 / country :name (n2 / name :op1 "Italy"))))
